title: What is  earthquake weather ?
message:
(KRON) — Californians might have previously stumbled upon the term “earthquake weather,” which someone would refer to when experiencing weather that supposedly precedes an earthquake.
So, what exactly is earthquake weather?
Where did earthquake weather originate?
had reason to believe in the earthquake theory because they believed a large amount of air was underground, and the weather would often be calm and warm before an earthquake.
(Photo by Dimas Ardian/Getty Images)Despite having preceding weather conditions for other weather disasters such as a tsunami or a hurricane, the USGS says, “There is no such thing as ‘earthquake weather.” Statistically speaking, earthquakes actually happen in both warmer and colder weather.

title: Ernesto weakens to tropical storm after lashing Bermuda as hurricane
message:
Ernesto has been downgraded to a tropical storm after passing over the Caribbean island of Bermuda as a hurricane without causing major damage.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic season.
Cape Hatteras National Seashore via APAll tropical alerts associated with Ernesto have now expired, with the storm far out at sea.
A new tropical storm watch may be issued for southern Newfoundland later today, according to the National Hurricane Center.
A man watches waves as the eye of Hurricane Ernesto passes the harbour of Hamilton, Bermuda August 17, 2024.

title: Ernesto weakens to tropical storm after lashing Bermuda as hurricane
message:
Ernesto weakens to tropical storm after lashing Bermuda as hurricaneErnesto has been downgraded to a tropical storm after passing over the Caribbean island of Bermuda as a hurricane without causing major damage.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year's Atlantic season.
Increased speed may see Ernesto again cross the 74 mph sustained winds threshold to return to Category 1 hurricane status.
All tropical alerts associated with Ernesto have now expired, with the storm far out at sea.
A new tropical storm watch may be issued for southern Newfoundland later today, according to the National Hurricane Center.

title: Hurricane Ernesto Weakens Into Tropical Storm as It Moves Away From Bermuda Over Open Waters
message:
The National Hurricane Center had warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding for Bermuda.
A tropical storm warning would remain in place into the night, Pitcher said.
“Overnight, there will still be tropical storm force winds, and we’re asking everyone to please exercise caution,” he said.
The hurricane center reported life-threatening surf and rip currents on the East Coast of the United States and Canada.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Hurricane Ernesto weakens into tropical storm as it moves away from Bermuda
message:
Hurricane Ernesto weakened into a tropical storm late Saturday as it moved away from Bermuda over open waters of the Atlantic after crossing over the tiny British territory early in the day with heavy rains and strong winds.
The National Hurricane Center had warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding for Bermuda.
A tropical storm warning would remain in place into the night, Pitcher said.
"Overnight, there will still be tropical storm force winds, and we're asking everyone to please exercise caution," he said.
The hurricane center reported life-threatening surf and rip currents on the East Coast of the United States and Canada.

title: Hurricane tracker : Ernesto moves away from Bermuda
message:
Earlier, the U.S. National Hurricane Centre warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding.
Due to the large size of the storm and its slow movement, tropical storm force winds and gusts up to hurricane force were expected through Saturday night.
Late Saturday afternoon, Michelle Pitcher, director of the Bermuda Weather Service, said wind gusts were still reaching hurricane force.
“Overnight, there will still be tropical storm force winds, and we’re asking everyone to please exercise caution,” he said.

title: Hurricane Ernesto moves away from Bermuda to open waters
message:
Hurricane Ernesto moves away from Bermuda to open watersMEXICO CITY (AP) — Hurricane Ernesto moved away from Bermuda on Saturday evening over open waters of the Atlantic after crossing over the tiny British territory early in the day with heavy rains and strong winds.
Earlier, the National Hurricane Center warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding.
Due to the large size of the storm and its slow movement, tropical storm force winds and gusts up to hurricane force were expected through Saturday night.
Late Saturday afternoon, Michelle Pitcher, director of the Bermuda Weather Service, said wind gusts were still reaching hurricane force.
“Overnight, there will still be tropical storm force winds, and we’re asking everyone to please exercise caution,” he said.

Due to the large size of the storm and its slow movement, tropical storm force winds and gusts up to hurricane force were expected through Saturday night.
Late Saturday afternoon, Michelle Pitcher, director of the Bermuda Weather Service, said wind gusts were still reaching hurricane force.
“Overnight, there will still be tropical storm force winds, and we’re asking everyone to please exercise caution,” he said.

title: Hurricane Ernesto moves away from Bermuda to open waters
message:
Hurricane Ernesto, which made landfall on the tiny British Atlantic territory of Bermuda early Saturday, brought heavy rains and strong winds before moving north-northeast away from the area.
Earlier, the National Hurricane Center warned of strong winds, a dangerous storm surge and significant coastal flooding.
But the hurricane warning for the area was later downgraded to a tropical storm warning.
The hurricane center reported life-threatening surf and rip currents on the East Coast of the United States and said they would reach Canada during the day.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Ireland on hurricane watch as Met Eireann gives exact date remnants could trigger severe weather
message:
While its exact path is uncertain at this stage, Met Eireann said it's remnants could lash Ireland with wet and windy weather next week.

Rain warnings are possible during this period.”(Image: WXCharts)This comes as alarm has been raised over an unusually active Atlantic hurricane system.
The peak of the Atlantic hurricane season occurs on September 10th with most hurricanes usually happening between mid-August and mid-October.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of this year’s Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Hurricane Ernesto makes landfall in Bermuda , weakens to Category 1
message:
Hurricane Ernesto makes landfall in Bermuda, weakens to Category 1Hurricane Ernesto weakened to a Category 1 storm overnight as it bore down on Bermuda.
The eye of the storm made landfall before 5 a.m. with sustained winds of 85 mph.
Hurricane Ernesto is expected to slowly move away from Bermuda by Saturday, but the high surf and rip current threat will continue for days on the East Coast.
Rainfall amounts of 6 to 9 inches are expected in Bermuda for storm-total accumulation.
Ernesto will continue moving north and northeast with the storm expected to be a dying hurricane as is moves off the coast of Newfoundland, Canada on Monday night.

title: Hurricane Ernesto slams Bermuda , creates East Coast rip current risk
message:
Strong Winds, dangerous storm surge, and life-threatening flooding expected to continue on Bermuda today.
More than 18 million people are under alerts with high surf and dangerous rip currents stretching from Florida to Maine.
Officials say two men drowned at separate beaches on hilton head island in South Carolina friday due to those strong rip currents.
As seen with this hurricane, rip currents are dangerous and can be sneaky if not paid attention to.
Expect high surf and dangerous rip currents at area beaches tomorrow and Monday.

title: Hurricane Ernesto downgraded to tropical storm as it exits Bermuda
message:
This satellite image obtained from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration shows Hurricane Ernesto at 14:50 Zulu on August 17, 2024.
Photo by Handout / NOAA/GOES / AFPAFPMiami: Hurricane Ernesto was downgraded to a tropical storm Saturday after it lashed Bermuda with heavy rains and strong winds, leaving much of the British Atlantic Ocean territory without power before continuing on its path toward eastern Canada.
The hurricane, which hit Puerto Rico earlier this week, "will move away from Bermuda" Saturday night but would still create tropical storm conditions, according to the US-based National Hurricane Center.
It warned that it was possible for the storm to intensify on Sunday "and Ernesto could regain hurricane status."
"Even though we have been downgraded from hurricane to tropical storm, we must remember that some gusts will be intense," Minister of National Security Michael Weeks said Saturday, according to The Royal Gazette newspaper.

Rainfall amounts of 6 to 9 inches are expected in Bermuda for storm-total accumulation.
Ernesto will continue moving north and northeast with the storm expected to be a dying hurricane as is moves off the coast of Newfoundland, Canada on Monday night.

title: Thousands without power as Ernesto exits Bermuda
message:
MIAMI, Aug 18, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Hurricane Ernesto lashed Bermuda with heavy rains and strong winds Saturday, leaving much of the British Atlantic Ocean territory without power before continuing on its path toward eastern Canada.
The hurricane, which hit Puerto Rico earlier this week, was "inching away from Bermuda" but still creating powerful tropical storm conditions as of Saturday evening, according to the US-based National Hurricane Center.
"This rainfall will likely result in considerable life-threatening flash flooding to the island, especially in low-lying areas," the NHC said.
Images on social media showed downed trees blocking roads, power lines damaged by the storm's high winds and flooded roads.
Ernesto was moving northeast and expected to slowly depart Bermuda Saturday and move near or east of Newfoundland in eastern Canada on Monday night, the NHC said.

title: Hurricane Ernesto knocks out power in Bermuda
message:
Hurricane Ernesto knocked out power, downed trees and flooded parts of Bermuda on Saturday but the British island territory appeared to have escaped major injuries or property damage, officials said after an initial assessment.
Some 5.9 inches (150 mm) of rain had fallen and more was expected from the back end of the storm, Michelle Pitcher, director of the Bermuda Weather Service, said on the video.
The US National Weather Service said the hurricane was tracking north-northeast.
The center of the storm is forecast to approach southeastern Newfoundland in Canada late on Monday, the US weather service said.
Electric utility BELCO said the storm caused near island-wide outages, with about 25,800 customers without power as of Saturday afternoon.

title: Hurricane Ernesto downgraded to tropical storm as it exits Bermuda

title: Hundreds of miles away , Hurricane Ernesto still affects US beaches with rip currents , house collapse
message:
In North Carolina’s Outer Banks, the National Park Service confirmed the collapse of the house Friday night in Rodanthe, one of several communities on Hatteras Island.
No injuries were reported, the park service reported.
The park service said in a statement that other homes in and near Rodanthe appeared to have sustained damage.
The park service urged visitors this weekend to avoid the Rodanthe beaches and surf, adding that dangerous debris may be on the beach and the water for several miles.
Significant debris removal wasn’t expected until early next week after the elevated sea conditions subside, the park service said.

title: Bermuda braces for direct hit from Hurricane Ernesto
message:
Bermuda braces for direct hit from Hurricane Ernestoby AFP Staff WritersMiami (AFP) Aug 16, 2024Bermuda was on high alert Friday as residents brace for Hurricane Ernesto, with heavy rain and flooding expected to wallop the island at the weekend, meteorologists and officials said.
"Ernesto is forecast to be a large hurricane near Bermuda on Saturday and maintain hurricane strength through the weekend," the NHC said in its latest advisory.
The large storm, currently a Category 2 hurricane on the five-level Saffir-Simpson scale, is set to strengthen overnight.
As the territory's emergency officials met Thursday, Minister of National Security Michael Weeks urged residents to complete their hurricane preparation as soon as possible.
Related LinksBringing Order To A World Of DisastersWhen the Earth QuakesA world of storm and tempest

title: Hurricane Ernesto  remnant to bringing heavy downpours and 60mph gusts
message:
The “remnants” of Hurricane Ernesto are set to batter the parts of the UK in the week ahead, bringing heavy rain and wind gusts of up to 60mph, the Met Office has warned.
Ernesto ripped through the North Atlantic this week, with maximum winds of 85mph leaving hundreds of thousands of people in Puerto Rico and Bermuda without power.
The rain will be accompanied by strong south-westerly winds, with gusts reaching 50-60mph possible on the coast and around the islands.
The Met Office said there could be delays to public transport, spray and flooding on roads, as well as potential power cuts and flooding in homes and businesses.
“Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of the Atlantic hurricane season.

title: 6am update : Ernesto is no longer a threat to Bermuda
message:
As of 6am on Sunday, the Bermuda Weather Service reported that the centre of the storm was 190 miles north-northeast of Bermuda and moving away from the island at 9mph.
Forecasters warned yesterday that gusts are still reaching hurricane strength and tropical storm conditions may still be felt on the island through the evening.
“It looks as though we will be under a Tropical Storm Warning at least through early this evening, if not until midnight,” she said.
Hurricane winds extend outward up to 60 miles from the centre of the storm, while tropical storm force winds extend up to 230 miles.
“Tropical storm conditions are likely to continue on Bermuda for the next several hours,” the NHC said.

message:
Ernesto has been downgraded to a tropical storm as of the 11PM advisory Saturday night.

title: 7 . 0 magnitude earthquake strikes off coast of Russia
message:
Beijing, Aug 18 : A 7.0-magnitude earthquake jolted a sea area off the east coast of Kamchatka, Russia on Sunday morning, according to the China Earthquake Networks Center (CENC).
The epicentre was monitored at 52.8 degrees north latitude and 160.15 degrees east longitude.
The quake struck at a depth of 50 km, Xinhua news agency reported, citing a report issued by the CENC.
The US National Tsunami Warning Center had initially issued a tsunami threat, but later said the threat had passed.
"Based on all available data... the tsunami threat from this earthquake has now passed," it said, adding that minor sea level fluctuations "may occur in some coastal areas near the earthquake over the next few hours."

title: 7 . 0 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Coast Of Eastern Russia
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Beijing, Aug 18 (IANS) A 7.0-magnitude earthquake jolted a sea area off the east coast of Kamchatka, Russia on Sunday morning, according to the China Earthquake Networks Center (CENC).
The epicentre was monitored at 52.8 degrees north latitude and 160.15 degrees east longitude.
The quake struck at a depth of 50 km, Xinhua news agency reported, citing a report issued by the CENC.
The US National Tsunami Warning Center had initially issued a tsunami threat, but later said the threat had passed.
"Based on all available data... the tsunami threat from this earthquake has now passed," it said, adding that minor sea level fluctuations "may occur in some coastal areas near the earthquake over the next few hours."

title: Hurricane Ernesto remains set to batter Britain with 83mph winds and heavy rain
message:
Something went wrong, please try again later.

Weather forecasters have raised alarms that indicate Hurricane Ernesto's remnants are expected to strike Britain in the coming days.
Storm maps are predicting heavy rain and lightning to sweep across the country, starting Wednesday evening and intensifying by Thursday.

title: Scotland weather : Met Office issue three rain warnings
message:
The Met Office warnings cover south-west Scotland and the Lothian borders on Monday afternoon and evening, and north-east Scotland – including the Highlands, Strathclyde and Central, Tayside and Fife – for most of Wednesday and Thursday.
The forecaster said the rain on Wednesday and Thursday could be accompanied by strong winds of up to 60mph as the remnants of Hurricane Ernesto hit the UK.
There was a small chance the spring tide will generate large waves which could result in injuries and danger to life in coastal areas on Wednesday and Thursday, the Met Office added.
Met Office forecaster Craig Snell said: “Ernesto, at the moment, is still out on the other side of the Atlantic as a tropical storm.
Ernesto is the fifth named storm and the third hurricane of the Atlantic hurricane season.

title: Powerful Earthquake Hits Off Far East Coast of Russia
message:
PETROPAVOVSK-KAMCHATSKY, Russia—A powerful earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.0 struck in the Pacific off the far eastern coast of Russia near a major naval base early Sunday, but there were no early reports of damage or injuries.
The quake prompted a tsunami warning that was later lifted.
The earthquake occurred 18 miles (29 kilometers) below the surface and its epicenter was about 63 miles (102 kilometers) east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the U.S. Geological Survey said.
The U.S. National Weather Service’s Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Honolulu initially warned that hazardous tsunami waves were possible for coasts within 300 miles (480 kilometers) of the earthquake epicenter, but later announced the threat had ended.
The center said minor sea level fluctuations could occur in some coastal areas near the earthquake site for several hours.

title: Massive 7 . 2 magnitude earthquake strikes off Russia east coast as tsunami warning issued by authorities
message:
A 7.2 magnitude earthquake has struck off the coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia's far east on Sunday morning.
The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMCS) reported the tremor occurred at 7.10am local time (5.10am AEST).
Russian authorities have issued a tsunami warning after a 7.2 magnitude earthquake hit off the nation's east coast.
The US National Tsunami Warning Centre has issued a tsunami warning but the waves have been estimated to reach just “0.3m-1m” above tide level.
Further tremors of about 4.0 to 5.0 magnitude have been recorded in the hours following the initial earthquake.

title: Shiveluch Volcano Erupts After 7 . 0 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Eastern Russian Coast ; Visuals Surface
message:
X | @WeatherSarov1Moscow: Shiveluch volcano in Russia erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country, CNN reported, citing TASS.
As per the visual evaluations, the ash column is rising as high as 8 kilometres above the sea level, CNN reported, citing TASS.
Shiveluch volcano eruption in Kamchatka, August 18 2024.
However, buildings are being examined for potential damage, with special attention paid to social facilities, CNN reported, citing TASS.
No Tsunami Warning Issued By The Russian Emergencies MinistryThe Russian Emergencies Ministry did not issue a tsunami warning due to the tremor.

The quake prompted a tsunami warning that was later lifted.
The earthquake occurred 18 miles (29 kilometers) below the surface and its epicenter was about 63 miles (102 kilometers) east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the U.S. Geological Survey said.
The U.S. National Weather Service's Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Honolulu initially warned that hazardous tsunami waves were possible for coasts within 300 miles (480 kilometers) of the earthquake epicenter, but later announced the threat had ended.
The center said minor sea level fluctuations could occur in some coastal areas near the earthquake site for several hours.

This has led the Met Office to issue warnings for heavy wind and rain starting Wednesday evening.
Storm maps are predicting heavy rain and lightning to sweep across most of the country, starting Wednesday evening and intensifying on Thursday.

title: Powerful earthquake hits off far east coast of Russia , though no early reports of damage
message:
A powerful earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.0 struck in the Pacific off the far eastern coast of Russia near a major naval base early Sunday, but there were no early reports of damage or injuries.
The quake prompted a tsunami warning that was later lifted.
The earthquake occurred 18 miles (29 kilometers) below the surface and its epicenter was about 63 miles (102 kilometers) east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the U.S. Geological Survey said.
The U.S. National Weather Service's Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Honolulu initially warned that hazardous tsunami waves were possible for coasts within 300 miles (480 kilometers) of the earthquake epicenter, but later announced the threat had ended.
The center said minor sea level fluctuations could occur in some coastal areas near the earthquake site for several hours.

title: Volcano erupts in Russia after 7 . 0 magnitude earthquake , ash soars to 8 km high
message:
Earthquake rocks Russia's eastern regionTsunami Warning lifted(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelThe Shiveluch volcano , located in Russia ’s Far Eastern Kamchatka region, has erupted, sending ash as high as 8 km into the sky, Russian agency TASS reported.
According to the Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, part of the Far Eastern Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, the ash column has risen as high as 8 kilometers above sea level.
The eruption has also led to the release of a significant amount of lava.Shiveluch is one of the largest and most active volcanoes on the Kamchatka Peninsula, standing at a height of 3,283 meters.
The earthquake, which had its epicenter about 63 miles (102 kilometers) east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, occurred at a depth of 29 kilometers below the surface.
Following the earthquake, the US National Weather Service's Pacific Tsunami Warning Center in Honolulu issued a warning that hazardous tsunami waves were possible for coasts within 300 miles (480 kilometers) of the epicenter.

title: Shiveluch volcano erupts after 7 . 0 magnitude earthquake strikes off eastern Russian coast
message:
“Shiveluch volcano in Russia erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country,” CNN reported, citing TASS.
As per the visual evaluations, the ash column is rising as high as 8km above the sea level, CNN reported, citing TASS.
The quake caused no “major damage.” However, buildings are being examined for potential damage, with special attention paid to social facilities, CNN reported, citing TASS.
The Russian Emergencies Ministry did not issue a tsunami warning due to the tremor.
Furniture toppled and dishes were broken due to the earthquake, TASS reported.

title: Shiveluch volcano erupts after 7 . 0 magnitude earthquake strikes off eastern Russian coast
message:
As per the visual evaluations, the ash column is rising as high as 8 kilometres above the sea level, CNN reported, citing TASS.
Shiveluch volcano is located around 280 miles from Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, a coastal city that has a population of about 181,000 that lies in Russia's Kamchatka.
However, buildings are being examined for potential damage, with special attention paid to social facilities, CNN reported, citing TASS.
The Russian Emergencies Ministry did not issue a tsunami warning due to the tremor.
Furniture toppled and dishes were broken due to the earthquake, TASS reported.

title: Volcano erupts in Russia after 7 . 0 magnitude earthquake
message:
Russia’s Shiveluch volcano in the Kamchatka region erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country, local media reported on Sunday.
AdvertisementEarlier on Saturday night (local time), a 7.0-magnitude earthquake jolted a sea area off the east coast of Kamchatka.
The quake struck at a depth of 50 km, according to a report issued by the China Earthquake Networks Center.
The US National Tsunami Warning Center had initially issued a tsunami threat, but later said the threat had passed.
Most of them were not felt on the land, TASS reported, citing the ministry.

title: Massive 7 . 0 Magnitude Earthquake Rattles Russia Far East Coast
message:
A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck off the coast of Russia’s far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early Sunday morning local time, according to the regional earthquake monitoring service.
The local emergencies ministry said tremors were felt along the coast including in the region’s capital Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky.
“Operational teams of rescuers and firefighters are inspecting buildings,” the regional branch of Russia’s emergencies ministry in the Kamchatka region said on Telegram.
The earthquake struck at a depth of nearly 50 kilometres (30 miles) just after 7:00 am local time, some 90 kilometres east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the United States Geological Survey reported.
The US National Tsunami Warning Center had initially issued a tsunami threat, but later said the threat had passed.

title: Magnitude 7 earthquake strikes off coast of Russia Kamchatka region
message:
A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck off the coast of Russia's far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early Sunday morning local time, according to the regional earthquake monitoring service.
"Operational teams of rescuers and firefighters are inspecting buildings," the regional branch of Russia's emergencies ministry in the Kamchatka region said on Telegram.
The earthquake struck at a depth of nearly 50 kilometers just after 7 a.m. local time, some 90 kilometers east of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, the United States Geological Survey reported.
The U.S. National Tsunami Warning Center had initially issued a tsunami threat, but later said the threat had passed.
Several aftershocks were recorded after the initial quake, but of lower intensity, the Kamchatka branch of Russia's Unified Geophysical Service reported on its website.

title: Hurricane Ernesto downgraded to tropical storm as it exits Bermuda
message:
Hurricane Ernesto downgraded to tropical storm as it exits BermudaMiami, Aug 18 (AFP) Aug 18, 2024Hurricane Ernesto was downgraded to a tropical storm Saturday after it lashed Bermuda with heavy rains and strong winds, leaving much of the British Atlantic Ocean territory without power before continuing on its path toward eastern Canada.
The hurricane, which hit Puerto Rico earlier this week, "will move away from Bermuda" Saturday night but would still create tropical storm conditions, according to the US-based National Hurricane Center.
It warned that it was possible for the storm to intensify on Sunday "and Ernesto could regain hurricane status."
"Even though we have been downgraded from hurricane to tropical storm, we must remember that some gusts will be intense," Minister of National Security Michael Weeks said Saturday, according to The Royal Gazette newspaper.
Ernesto was moving northeast and expected to slowly depart Bermuda Saturday and move near or east of Newfoundland in eastern Canada on Monday night, the NHC said.
